info.name: Alexa Smart Properties - REST API Reference
info.description:
## Description:

This Postman Collection describes Alexa Smart Properties APIs that you can use to build Alexa capabilities into property management applications.

## How to use:

For usage instructions please see [https://github.com/alexa-smart-properties](https://github.com/alexa-smart-properties)/postman-collection-smart-properties-rest-apis

item.name: Authorization
item.description:
## To call the Alexa Smart Properties APIs, you must include your API access token as part of the Authorization request header of each API call.

## The API access token generation is based on a [Login With Amazon](https://developer.amazon.com/docs/login-with-amazon/documentation-overview.html) Security Profile usage.

item.name: Unit Management
Unit Settings

request.description:
Get the default music station preferences for a given unit.
---

*Required Request Path Parameters:*
- `unitId`: The unit ID, in the format "amzn1.alexa.unit.did.{id}".

---

[see Online Doc](https://developer.amazon.com/en-US/docs/alexa/alexa-smart-properties/asp-in-senior-living-unit-api.html#get-the-default-music-station-setting)

Set the default music station preferences for a given unit.
---

*Required Request Path Parameters:*
- `unitId`: The unit ID, in the format "amzn1.alexa.unit.did.{id}".

*Required Request BOdy Parameters:*
- `providerId`: The radio station provider ID.
- `stationId`: The station ID.

**Note:** Supported values for both `providerId` and `sationId` are available from online documentation [here](https://developer.amazon.com/en-US/docs/alexa/alexa-smart-properties/asp-in-senior-living-unit-api.html#provider-station-id).

---

[see Online Doc](https://developer.amazon.com/en-US/docs/alexa/alexa-smart-properties/asp-in-senior-living-unit-api.html#set-the-default-music-station-setting)

Use the Unit API to manage unit settings for Alexa Smart Ppoperties units such as rooms.
---

item.name: List Units -  1-Depth Level from Organization ID

query.description: Identifier of the unit for which child units should be returned. In format of "amzn1.alexa.unit.did.{id}".

request.description:
List Units
---

Call `GET /v2/units/` to retrieve units. If there are no child units, an empty list will be returned. Only units that are accessible by the caller will be returned. All subunits will be returned up to depth specified (if any).

*Required Request Path Parameters:*
- `parentId` : Identifier of the unit for which child units should be returned. In format of "amzn1.alexa.unit.did.{id}".

Only Unit Identifier will be returned when no details are requested (i.e without query param `expand=all`

---

[see Online Doc](https://developer.amazon.com/en-US/docs/alexa/alexa-smart-properties/asp-in-senior-living-property-hierarchy-management-api.html#list-units)

item.name: List Units -  1-Depth Level from Organization ID + Full Details

query.description: Identifier of the unit for which child units should be returned. In format of "amzn1.alexa.unit.did.{id}".

An attribute (or set of attributes) to include in the response. Current values supported: all
If expand=all is not passed in the request, only the id property of the unit is returned in the response.

request.description:
List Units
---

Call `GET /v2/units/` to retrieve units. If there are no child units, an empty list will be returned. Only units that are accessible by the caller will be returned. All subunits will be returned up to depth specified (if any).

*Required Request Path Parameters:*
- `parentId` : Identifier of the unit for which child units should be returned. In format of "amzn1.alexa.unit.did.{id}".

---

[see Online Doc](https://developer.amazon.com/en-US/docs/alexa/alexa-smart-properties/asp-in-senior-living-property-hierarchy-management-api.html#list-units)

Retrieve Unit
---


*Required Request Path Parameters:*
- `unitId`: Identifier for the unit you want to retrieve in the following format "amzn1.alexa.unit.did.{id}".

---

[see Online Doc](https://developer.amazon.com/en-US/docs/alexa/alexa-smart-properties/asp-in-senior-living-property-hierarchy-management-api.html#get-a-unit)

Create a unit to represent a physical unit (e.g. property, floor, wing, room) in your property
---

A Unit is an administrative construct for organizing people and resources (skill, devices) that interact with Alexa systems. Units are hierarchical in nature and can have zero or more sub units. A Unit's parent cannot be any of its sub units.

*Required Request Body Parameters:*
- `name.type` : The type of format the name.value field is expected in. Accepted value: PLAIN
- `name.value` : The name of the unit.
- `parentId` : Unit under which the newly created unit will exist.

---

[see Online Doc](https://developer.amazon.com/en-US/docs/alexa/alexa-smart-properties/asp-in-senior-living-property-hierarchy-management-api.html#create-a-unit)

Update the name of the unit
---

Currently an endpoint can only be associated with one unit at a time.

*Required Request Path Parameters:*
- `unitId`: Identifier for the unit you want to update in the following format "amzn1.alexa.unit.did.{id}".

---

[see Online Doc](https://developer.amazon.com/en-US/docs/alexa/alexa-smart-properties/asp-in-senior-living-property-hierarchy-management-api.html#update-a-unit)

Delete a unit.
---

Currently an endpoint can only be associated with one unit at a time.

*Required Request Path Parameters:*
- `unitId`: Identifier for the unit you want to update in the following format "amzn1.alexa.unit.did.{id}".

**Important**: If the unit has child Units, 400 Bad request will be returned.

---

[see Online Doc](https://developer.amazon.com/en-US/docs/alexa/alexa-smart-properties/asp-in-senior-living-property-hierarchy-management-api.html#delete-a-unit)

Get the list of role assignments for the specified principal for the specified unit (property or room type or room).
---
*Required Request Path Parameters:*

*Required Request Query Parameters:*
- `principalId`: The principal ID, in the format "amzn1.account.{id}".
- `unitId`: The unit ID, in the Amazon Common Identifier (ACI) format "amzn1.alexa.role.did.{id}".

---

[see Online Doc](https://developer.amazon.com/en-US/docs/alexa/alexa-smart-properties/asp-in-senior-living-role-api.html#list-role-assignments-for-a-principal)

Assign a role to the specified principal (user ID).
---
*Required Request Path Parameters:*
- `roleId`: The role ID, in the Amazon Common Identifier (ACI) format "amzn1.alexa.role.did.{id}". Use this ID to assign the role to users.

*Required Request Body Parameters:*
- `principalId`: User ID of the principal to whom to assign the role.

---
For details about how to retrieve the principal (user ID) that you'll need for the principal, see [Obtain Customer Profile Information](https://developer.amazon.com/docs/login-with-amazon/obtain-customer-profile.html)

**Note:** This API throws a 400 Bad Request Exception if you attempt to assign a role to a principal who is already assigned that particular role.

[see Online Doc](https://developer.amazon.com/en-US/docs/alexa/alexa-smart-properties/asp-in-senior-living-role-api.html#assignRole)

item.name: Bulk Operation - Assign Role to Principal

request.description:
Batch Assign a role to multiple principals (user ID).
---
*Required Request Path Parameters:*
- `roleId`: The role ID, in the Amazon Common Identifier (ACI) format "amzn1.alexa.role.did.{id}". Use this ID to assign the role to users.

*Required Request Body Parameters:*
- `items `: Array of assign role request objects. The maximum number of request items in the batch request is 50.
- `items[*].itemId`: Unique identifier for the request item.
- `items[*].principalId`: User ID of the principal to whom to assign the role.

**Note**: After accepting the request, this operation performs synchronous validations and then returns a 202 (Accepted) response. Each principal is then assigned to the role asynchronously in the background.

In the case of invalid inputs, the entire batch operation fails. That is, either all the request items are processed or none.

---
For details about how to retrieve the principal (user ID) that you'll need for the principal, see [Obtain Customer Profile Information](https://developer.amazon.com/docs/login-with-amazon/obtain-customer-profile.html)

**Note:** This API throws a 400 Bad Request Exception if you attempt to assign a role to a principal who is already assigned that particular role.

[see Online Doc](https://developer.amazon.com/en-US/docs/alexa/alexa-smart-properties/asp-in-senior-living-role-api.html#batch-assign-role)

Batch revoke a role for multiple principals (user ID).
---
*Required Request Path Parameters:*
- `roleId`: The role ID, in the Amazon Common Identifier (ACI) format "amzn1.alexa.role.did.{id}". Use this ID to assign the role to users.

*Required Request Body Parameters:*
- `items `: Array of assign role request objects. The maximum number of request items in the batch request is 50.
- `items[*].itemId`: Unique identifier for the request item.
- `items[*].principalId`: User ID of the principal to whom to assign the role.

**Note**: After accepting the request, this operation performs perform synchronous validations and then returns a 202 (Accepted) response. Each principal is then revoked for the role asynchronously in the background.

In the case of invalid inputs, the entire batch operation fails. That is, either all the request items are processed or none.

---
For details about how to retrieve the principal (user ID) that you'll need for the principal, see [Obtain Customer Profile Information](https://developer.amazon.com/docs/login-with-amazon/obtain-customer-profile.html)

Update the list of associated units for an endpoint.
---

Currently an endpoint can only be associated with one unit at a time.

*Required Request Path Parameters:*
- `endpointid`: The endpoint ID, in the Amazon Common Identifier (ACI) format "amzn1.alexa.endpoint.{id}".

*Required Request Body Parameters:*
- The list of units to associate with the endpoint. Each element in the array is a unit ID, in the format "amzn1.alexa.unit.did.{id}". 

**Important**: The endpoint must have an active connection when changing unit associations. Please keep the device powered on and online for 1 minute after successfully calling this API.

**Warning**: *When you change unit associations for an endpoint, the `endpointId` might change. The new `endpointId` is returned in the response.*

**Note:** Settings should be applied only after a device is associated with a unit. Any settings that have been applied to a device are cleared when its unit association is updated. After the `PUT associatedUnits` API is called and a 200 code is returned, you should confirm that the endpoint was successfully restarted. 

---

[see Online Doc](https://developer.amazon.com/en-US/docs/alexa/alexa-smart-properties/asp-in-senior-living-endpoint-api.html#assign-endpoint-to-unit)

item.name: Query Endpoint Status from Mac Address

query.description: the Device Mac Address
the Device Connectivity Status

request.description:
Query an Endpoint Status from its MacAddress
---

After you've called the PUT associatedUnits API and received a 200 code, the process to associate the endpoint with the unit is complete on the cloud side. However, the physical endpoint must complete an automatic reboot to complete the endpoint-to-unit association on the endpoint side. There are no steps required to automatically reboot the endpoint.

To check if the endpoint has successfully rebooted, you can poll for the connectivity status of the endpoint. We recommend a polling interval of 2 minutes or greater.

When this API returns an endpointId, the endpoint has successfully rebooted and reconnected to the network.

*Required Request Query Parameters:*
- `connections.macAddress`: Filter endpoints to only those endpoints that match a particular Mac Address
- `connections.macAddress`: Filter endpoints to only those endpoints that have an online connectivity status (`OK`)

---
[see Online Doc](https://developer.amazon.com/en-US/docs/alexa/alexa-smart-properties/asp-in-senior-living-endpoint-api.html#query-endpoint-status)

request.description:
Retrieve speaker-feature properties (e.g volume) and their corresponding values of the specified endpoint.
---

*Required Request Query Parameters:*
- `endpointId`: The endpoint ID, in the Amazon Common Identifier (ACI) format "amzn1.alexa.endpoint.{id}".

---

[see Online Doc](https://developer.amazon.com/en-US/docs/alexa/alexa-smart-properties/asp-in-senior-living-endpoint-api.html#get-featuresspeaker)

Set speaker volume to the specified value on the specified endpoint.
---

*Required Request Query Parameters:*
- `endpointId`: The endpoint ID, in the Amazon Common Identifier (ACI) format "amzn1.alexa.endpoint.{id}".

*Required Request Body Parameters:*
- `volume`: The absolute volume to set endpoint's speaker volume to. Valid range is 0 to 100.

---

[see Online Doc](https://developer.amazon.com/en-US/docs/alexa/alexa-smart-properties/asp-in-senior-living-endpoint-api.html#post-featuresspeaker)

Adjust speaker volume by the specified value on the specified endpoint.
---

*Required Request Query Parameters:*
- `endpointId`: The endpoint ID, in the Amazon Common Identifier (ACI) format "amzn1.alexa.endpoint.{id}".

*Required Request Body Parameters:*
- `volumeDelta`: The relative volume to adjust the endpoint's speaker volume by. Valid range is -100 to 100. If the volume of the endpoint is already set to '20', and adjustVolume operation is invoked to adjust the endpoint volume by '-30', the endpoint volume is set to 0. Similarly, if the volume of the endpoint is already set to '20' and adjustVolume operation is invoked to adjust the endpoint volume by '90', the endpoint volume is set to 100

---

[see Online Doc](https://developer.amazon.com/en-US/docs/alexa/alexa-smart-properties/asp-in-senior-living-endpoint-api.html#post-featuresspeaker)

This setting prevents notifications and proactive experiences (calls, etc.) from disturbing the user.

Update the DoNotDisturb setting. 
---

This setting prevents notifications and proactive experiences (calls, etc.) from disturbing the user.

*Required Request Query Parameters:*

*Required Request Body Value:*

---

[see Online Doc](https://developer.amazon.com/en-US/docs/alexa/alexa-smart-properties/asp-in-senior-living-endpoint-api.html#put-donotdisturb-setting)

Get the user's preferred locales.
---

In the context of an Alexa device, this setting controls which languages the Alexa-enabled device is expected to understand and respond with.

*Required Request Query Parameters:*
- `endpointId`: The endpoint ID, in the Amazon Common Identifier (ACI) format "amzn1.alexa.endpoint.{id}".

---

[see Online Doc](https://developer.amazon.com/en-US/docs/alexa/alexa-smart-properties/asp-in-senior-living-endpoint-api.html#get-locales-setting)

Update the locale setting of the endpoint
---

In the context of an Alexa device, this setting controls which languages the Alexa-enabled device is expected to understand and respond with.

*Required Request Query Parameters:*
- `endpointId`: The endpoint ID, in the Amazon Common Identifier (ACI) format "amzn1.alexa.endpoint.{id}".

*Required Request Body Value:*
- List of locale strings. Specify at least one and no more than two locales. The first element in the list specifies the preferred locale. The following locales are supported: `de-DE`, `en-AU`, `en-CA`, `en-GB`, `en-IN`, `en-US`, `es-ES`, `es-MX`, `fr-FR`, `fr-CA`, `hi-IN`, `it-IT`, `ja-JP`, `pt-BR`. 

---

[see Online Doc](https://developer.amazon.com/en-US/docs/alexa/alexa-smart-properties/asp-in-senior-living-endpoint-api.html#put-locales-setting)

Get the WakeWords setting.
---

This setting controls what alternative wake words the user can say to wake up Alexa.

*Required Request Query Parameters:*
- `endpointId`: The endpoint ID, in the Amazon Common Identifier (ACI) format "amzn1.alexa.endpoint.{id}".

---

[see Online Doc](https://developer.amazon.com/en-US/docs/alexa/alexa-smart-properties/asp-in-senior-living-endpoint-api.html#get-wakewords-setting)

Update the WakeWords setting.
---

This setting controls what alternative wake words the user can say to wake up Alexa.

The supported wake words are: `ALEXA`, `AMAZON`, `COMPUTER`, and `ECHO`. 

Currently you can only specify one wake word at a time. 

Not all devices support all wake words.

Not all locales support all wake words (e.g `COMPUTER` is not supported in `fr-FR`)

*Required Request Query Parameters:*
- `endpointId`: The endpoint ID, in the Amazon Common Identifier (ACI) format "amzn1.alexa.endpoint.{id}".

*Required Request Body Value:*
- List of wake words, for example, ["ALEXA"].


**Note:** Before you can update the `WakeWords` setting for a device, you must set the `Locales` setting. 

---

[see Online Doc](https://developer.amazon.com/en-US/docs/alexa/alexa-smart-properties/asp-in-senior-living-endpoint-api.html#put-wakewords-setting)

Get the WakeWord Confirmation setting.
---

 This setting enables the user to specify whether they want an audible tone to play in addition to the visual indicator when Alexa detects the wake word. The tone indicates that Alexa is now listening and capturing the request.

*Required Request Query Parameters:*
- `endpointId`: The endpoint ID, in the Amazon Common Identifier (ACI) format "amzn1.alexa.endpoint.{id}".

---

[see Online Doc](https://developer.integ.amazon.com/en-US/docs/alexa/alexa-smart-properties/asp-in-senior-living-endpoint-api.html#get-wakewordconfirmation-setting)

Update the WakeWord Confirmation setting.
---

This setting enables the user to specify whether they want an audible tone to play in addition to the visual indicator when Alexa detects the wake word. The tone indicates that Alexa is now listening and capturing the request.

The supported wake words confirmation settings are: `NONE` and `TONE`. 

*Required Request Query Parameters:*
- `endpointId`: The endpoint ID, in the Amazon Common Identifier (ACI) format "amzn1.alexa.endpoint.{id}".

*Required Request Body Value:*
- A string containing the desired speech confirmation setting. Alexa supported speech confirmation settings are `"TONE"` and `"NONE"`.
 

---

[see Online Doc](https://developer.amazon.com/en-US/docs/alexa/alexa-smart-properties/asp-in-senior-living-endpoint-api.html#put-wakewords-setting)

Get the end-of-request sound.
---

This setting allows the user to specify whether they want a short tone to play at the end of their request to Alexa to indicate that Alexa has finished listening to and capturing the request.

*Required Request Query Parameters:*
- `endpointId`: The endpoint ID, in the Amazon Common Identifier (ACI) format "amzn1.alexa.endpoint.{id}".

---

[see Online Doc](https://developer.amazon.com/en-US/docs/alexa/alexa-smart-properties/asp-in-senior-living-endpoint-api.html#get-speechconfirmation-setting)

Update the end-of-request sound setting.
---

This setting allows the user to specify whether they want a short tone to play at the end of their request to Alexa to indicate that Alexa has finished listening to and capturing the request.

*Required Request Query Parameters:*
- `endpointId`: The endpoint ID, in the Amazon Common Identifier (ACI) format "amzn1.alexa.endpoint.{id}".

*Required Request Body Value:*
- A string containing the desired speech confirmation setting. Alexa supported speech confirmation settings are `"TONE"` and `"NONE"`.

---

[see Online Doc](https://developer.amazon.com/en-US/docs/alexa/alexa-smart-properties/asp-in-senior-living-endpoint-api.html#put-speechconfirmation-setting)

Get the list of error suppressions.
---

This setting controls whether the device plays error audio cues (brief, distinctive sounds) for certain errors.

*Required Request Query Parameters:*
- `endpointId`: The endpoint ID, in the Amazon Common Identifier (ACI) format "amzn1.alexa.endpoint.{id}".

---

[see Online Doc](https://developer.amazon.com/en-US/docs/alexa/alexa-smart-properties/asp-in-senior-living-endpoint-api.html#get-errorsuppression-setting)

Update the list of error suppressions.
---

This setting controls whether the device plays error audio cues (brief, distinctive sounds) for certain errors.

*Required Request Query Parameters:*
- `endpointId`: The endpoint ID, in the Amazon Common Identifier (ACI) format "amzn1.alexa.endpoint.{id}".

*Required Request Query Parameters:*
- The list of error suppressions. Currently the only supported value is `["CONNECTIVITY"]`. An empty list shows that no errors are to be suppressed.

---

[see Online Doc](https://developer.amazon.com/en-US/docs/alexa/alexa-smart-properties/asp-in-senior-living-endpoint-api.html#put-errorsuppression-setting)

Get the list of setup mode privileges.
---

This setting controls the end user's ability to put a device into configuration mode via the setup mode process (for example, by long-pressing the Action button on a device).

Alexa supported list of setup mode privileges is, `["ALL_SETTINGS"]`. `["ALL_SETTINGS"]` allows the end user to put a device into setup mode. An empty list (`[]`) shows that setup mode is disabled.

*Required Request Query Parameters:*
- `endpointId`: The endpoint ID, in the Amazon Common Identifier (ACI) format "amzn1.alexa.endpoint.{id}".

**Note:** Setup mode is disabled when the endpoint is associated with a unit within a property. It's enabled when the endpoint is associated with the caller's default unit or when it's not associated with any unit.

---

[see Online Doc](https://developer.amazon.com/en-US/docs/alexa/alexa-smart-properties/asp-in-senior-living-endpoint-api.html#get-setupmodeprivileges-setting)

Get the follow-up mode setting
---

This setting enables Alexa to listen for a subsequent request from the user without requiring the user to say the wake word.

Valid values: `true` or `false`

*Required Request Path Parameters:*
- `endpointId`: The endpoint ID, in the Amazon Common Identifier (ACI) format "amzn1.alexa.endpoint.{id}".

---

[see Online Doc](https://developer.amazon.com/en-US/docs/alexa/alexa-smart-properties/asp-in-senior-living-endpoint-api.html#get-followup-setting)

Update the follow-up mode setting
---

This setting enables Alexa to listen for a subsequent request from the user without requiring the user to say the wake word.

Valid values: `true` or `false`

*Required Request Path Parameters:*
- `endpointId`: The endpoint ID, in the Amazon Common Identifier (ACI) format "amzn1.alexa.endpoint.{id}".


*Required Request Body:*
- `true` or `false`

---

[see Online Doc](https://developer.amazon.com/en-US/docs/alexa/alexa-smart-properties/asp-in-senior-living-endpoint-api.html#put-followup-setting)

Get the speaking rate setting.
---

This setting enables to adjust the speaking rate of Alexa to either a faster or slower pace.

item.name: Wifi Management

request.description:
Save Wi-Fi configurations in Amazon Locker for later use with an endpoint.
---
*Required Request Body Parameters:*
- `credentialConfiguration.privateSharedKey`: Private shared key. Must be enclosed in double quotation marks.
- `ssid`: Wifi configuration network name. Must be enclosed in double quotation marks.
- `keyManagement`: Wifi configuration security type. Valid values are `NONE` for open networks or `WPAPSK` for password-based Wi-Fi SSIDs.

**Note:** To use these requests, you'll need an LWA token with "credential_locker::wifi_management" and "alexa::enterprise:management" scopes.

**Warning:** Be mindful of the `Host` to be used to access Wifi APIs.
`Host` value must be `credential-locker-service.amazon.com`

---
[see Online Doc](https://developer.amazon.com/en-US/docs/alexa/alexa-smart-properties/asp-in-senior-living-endpoint-api.html#post-savewificonfigurations)

Associate saved Wi-Fi configurations with an endpoint.
---

*Required Request Path Parameters:*
- `endpointId`: The endpoint ID returned by the [Enumerate endpoints](https://developer.amazon.com/en-US/docs/alexa/alexa-smart-properties/asp-in-senior-living-endpoint-api.html#enumerate-endpoints) call.

*Required Request Body Parameters:*
- `ssid`: Wifi configuration network name. Must be enclosed in double quotation marks. Must be the same value used in the call to POST saveWifiConfigurations.
- `keyManagement`: Wifi configuration security type. Must be the same value used in the call to POST saveWifiConfigurations.

**Note:** You can associate up to 32 Wi-Fi configurations with each endpoint.

---
[see Online Doc](https://developer.amazon.com/en-US/docs/alexa/alexa-smart-properties/asp-in-senior-living-endpoint-api.html#post-addorupdatewificonfigurations)

---

*Required Request Path Parameters:*
- `endpointId`: The endpoint ID. Must be the same ID that you used in the call to POST `addOrUpdateWiFiConfigurations`.
- `operationId`: The operation ID. Must be the `submittedOperationId` value returned by the POST `addOrUpdateWifiConfigurations` call

---

item.description:
You can use the Alexa Notifications REST API to send notifications to your customers. You can specify either of the following notification types:
---

- **Device notification**  For headless devices like Amazon Echo Dot, this is a yellow ring and a chime sound. For multimodal devices, it's a banner and a persistent notification indicator.
- **Announcement**  For headless and multimodal devices, this is a voice announcement. Multimodal devices also display a message on the screen.
- **PersistentVisualAlert**  For multimodal devices only. This a persistent notification that's displayed on the screen until it expires or the guest or resident dismisses it.

Create a Discovery Session
---
This is initiated a discovery session on the Alexa Built-in device associated into a unit (e.g a room).

*Required Request Query Parameters:*

*Required Request Body Parameters:*

item.description:
In Alexa for Hospitality, you can use the Device Group Management API to create groups of devices within a unit.
---

A device group represents a group of devices that a user can control together by speaking to an Alexa Built-in device that's a member of the group.

Targeting can be explicit or implicit: 

- **Explicit targeting** happens when the user specifies a device group name, for example, "*Alexa, turn on the living room lights*".

- **Implicit targeting** happens when the user doesn't specify the group name. For example, if a user says, "*Alexa, turn on the lights*" to a device that's in a device group, Alexa turns on all lights in the group. 

Devices in a device group are typically located in the same physical space, but this isn't a requirement.

**Note:** An Alexa Built-in device can only be a member of one device group at a time.

request.description:
Create a communication profile.
---

When you create a communication profile, it enables the communication capability and creates a profileId for a unit.

*Required Request Body Parameters:*
- `type`: The type of ID you are using to create a communication profile.
- `id`: The unit ID you are using to create a communications profile, in the format "amzn1.alexa.unit.did.{UnitId}"

Create communication profiles in batch.
---

You can create profiles for up to 100 units in a single request (one profile per unit). 

Each unit receives a unique `profileId`. 

You can then add the `profileId` as a contact in the address book of a different unit.

- `type`: The type of ID you are using to create a communication profile.
- `id`: The unit ID you are using to create a communications profile, in the format "amzn1.alexa.unit.did.{UnitId}"
- `itemId`: The unique ID of a request item. Typically item IDs are a sequence of numbers from starting from 1.

**Note:**  If a profile already exists for the unit, the existing profileID for the unit is returned.

You can create a contact with either a phone number or a communication profile.

*Required Request Body Parameters:*
- `name`: The contact name. Must be between 1 and 50 characters long.
- `alexaCommunicationProfileId`: The id of your communication profile.

**Note:** You can't add both a phone number and a alexaCommunicationProfileId to the same contact.

item.description:
With this API, you can manage Address Books, Contacts and Communications Profile to enable Alexa 2 Alexa calling as well as Alexa 2 landline calling (PSTN).
---

Be aware of the following resources limits:

- Maximum number of contacts allowed in an address book: **2000**	
- Maximum number of address books that can be associated with a unit: **10**
- Maximum number of units that an address book can be associated with: **2500**
- Max number of phone numbers per contact: **3**
- Max number of address books per organization: **2500**

**Note**: PSTN calling is not yet supported in FR

request.description:
Obtain Customer Profile Information
---

Call `GET /user/profile/` to retrieve data about an Amazon Customer from their Account.

A customer profile contains the data that Login with Amazon applications can access regarding a particular customer. This includes: a unique ID for the user; the user's name, the user's email address, and their postal code. This data is divided into three scopes: profile, profile:user_id and postal_code.

Only the User ID (also known as the Principal ID) is required for usage with [ASP Role API](https://developer.amazon.com/en-US/docs/alexa/alexa-smart-properties/asp-in-senior-living-role-api.html).

**Note:** Host to be used is `api.amazon.com` *(Do not mistake it with `api.amazonalexa.com`).*

---

[see Online Doc](https://developer.amazon.com/docs/login-with-amazon/obtain-customer-profile.html#call-profile-endpoint)

item.name: Event Messenger
Subscription Configurations

query.description:
A parameter that filters subscription configurations to only the subscriptions that the caller owns.
The only value currently supported is "~caller", which represents your information in the bearer token.

request.description:
Gets Subscription Configurations.
---

*Required Request Query Parameters:*
- `owner`: A parameter that filters subscription configurations to only the subscriptions that the caller owns.
The only value currently supported is "~caller", which represents your information in the bearer token.

> **Note:** it only returns subscription configurations created by the customerId associated with the LWA token.

---
[see Online Doc](https://developer.amazon.com/en-US/docs/alexa/alexa-smart-properties/asp-core-event-messenger-api.html#get-subscription-configurations)

Gets Subscription Configurations.
---

*Required Request Path Parameters:*
- `id`: Unique ID of the subscription configuration to get. This ID is returned by the Create a subscription configuration operation.


> **Note:** Subscription Configuration identifiers have the following pattern: `amzn1.alexa.aem.subscription.configuration.{id}`

---
[see Online Doc](https://developer.amazon.com/en-US/docs/alexa/alexa-smart-properties/asp-core-event-messenger-api.html#get-subscription-configuration-by-id)

Creates a Subscription Configuration
---

A Subscription Configuration defines a delivery channel that multiple subscriptions can use.

Currently, the only supported delivery channel for events is [Amazon Simple Notification Service (SNS)](https://aws.amazon.com/sns/)

*Required Request Body Parameters:*
- `deliveryChannels`: List of delivery mechanism configuration objects.
- `deliveryChannels[*].type`: Type of delivery channel. Valid values: SNS.
- `deliveryChannels[*].id`: Identifier of the channel the update is required on. Valid values: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the SNS topic to which to publish events.

---
[see Online Doc](https://developer.amazon.com/en-US/docs/alexa/alexa-smart-properties/asp-core-event-messenger-api.html#create-subscription-configuration)

*Required Request Path Parameters:*
- `id`: Unique ID of the subscription configuration to delete.

- `id`: Unique ID of the subscription to get.

---
[see Online Doc](https://developer.amazon.com/en-US/docs/alexa/alexa-smart-properties/asp-core-event-messenger-api.html#get-subscription-by-id)

Creates a Subscription.
---

A subscriptions specifies the type of event you want to subscribe to and which subscription configuration to use.

*Required Request Body Parameters:*
- `subscriptionConfigurationId`: Configuration ID of the subscription configuration.
- `eventType`: Object that contains event details.
- `eventType.namespace`: Represents the category an event belongs to. All automation-related events share the same namespace.
- `eventType.name`: An event name within the namespace. 

---

The unit entity is required for the following events:

- `Alexa.Automation.Execution.Completion`
- `Alexa.Skill.Interaction.Failure`
- `Alexa.Enterprise.Subscription.Activation`

*Unit Entity parameter*

- `unit`: Object that represents the details of a unit.
- `unit.type`: Unit entity type. Valid values: `Unit`
- `unit.id`: Unit identifier
- `unit.parent`: Parent unit, which contains the parent ID.

> Note: When you subscribe to an Enterprise subscription activation event (`Alexa.Enterprise.Subscription.Activation`), only specify the parent.

---

The skill entity is required for the following events:

- `Alexa.Skill.Interaction.Failure`

*Skill Entity parameter*

- `skill`: Object that represents the details of a skill.
- `skill.type`: Skill entity type. Valid values: `Skill`
- `skill.id`: Skill identifier

---
[see Online Doc](https://developer.amazon.com/en-US/docs/alexa/alexa-smart-properties/asp-core-event-messenger-api.html#create-subscription)

Deletes a Subscription by ID.
---

*Required Request Path Parameters:*
- `id`: Unique ID of the subscription to delete.

---
[see Online Doc](https://developer.amazon.com/en-US/docs/alexa/alexa-smart-properties/asp-core-event-messenger-api.html#delete-subscription)

item.description: The Event Messenger API enables you to subscribe to receive Alexa events. These events enable you to take actions such as raising alarms and retrying operations.

exec: * Pre-request script ran before every API request.
* Get a new Access Token using the existing Refresh Token
* Refresh Operation is performed only if Access Token has expired.
// Determine if the Access Token has expired or do not exist
// Determine if we have all the client credentials needed in the environment
// Get LWA Securify Profile values from Variables
// if the access token expired (or dot not exist) use the refresh token to create a new access token
// send a new API request to refresh the access token
// if an error occured, log the error and raise a message to the user.
console.log('Could not refresh the access token')
throw new Error('Could not refresh the access token. Check the console for more details.')
console.log("New Access Token retrieved, updating Collection Variables");
// otherwise, fetch the new access token and store it
// determine when this token is set to expire at
// store the new variables in the environment
// otherwise, throw a message to the user if the access token expired.
throw new Error('Cannot Generate an AccessToken: Please provide a valid LWA Security Profile (ClientId and ClientSecret) along with a valid RefreshToken to generate a new Access Token');
// Good to go, Access Token is still valid
console.log("Access Token still valid, proceed to request execution")
